title: Sign of particles emitted during radioactive decay

content.question: A scientist is studying the radioactive decay of an element and wants to determine the sign of some of the particles emitted. The scientist lets a beam of the particles, all with the same speed, pass through an opening in a shield and enter the field created by a wire carrying a constant current. Paths 1 and 2 represent the observed paths of the particles. Based on the paths, which of the following could be the types of particles?

choices.label:
Path 1 Particle
 Path 2 Particle

Electron
 Alpha

Path 1 Particle
 Path 2 Particle

Alpha
 Electron

Path 1 Particle
 Path 2 Particle

Positron
 Alpha

Path 1 Particle
 Path 2 Particle

Alpha
 Positron

content.answer:
Path 1 Particle
 Path 2 Particle

Positron
 Alpha
